Petambak Garam Sampang Keluhkan Proyek Pembenahan Jalan
04 Nov 2019, 21:06 by Alfin Nuary


Petambak Garam Sampang Keluhkan Proyek Pembenahan Jalan

KBRN, Sampang : Sejumlah petambak garam pada, Senin (4/11/2019) mendatangi Dinas Pekerjaan Umum dan Penataan Ruang (DPUPR) Sampang. Mereka mempertanyakan soal kebijakan penggunaan akses jalan Desa Asem Nonggal - Panyepen, Kecamatan Jrengik, yang disinyalir merugikan petambak garam saat hendak mendistribusikan hasil garamnya ke luar daerah atau desa. Pasalnya, akses infrastruktur jalan tersebut dilakukan pembatasan tonase. Akibatnya masyarakat kemudian mengeluh karena merasa dirugikan terlebih pada biaya operasional transportasi dan tukang angkut karena harus mengeluarkan biaya tambahan.Tidak hanya soal kerugian operasionalnya saja, kata salah satu warva Asem Nonggal, Mahmudi menyampaikan, kerugian para petambak garam juga terjadi di saat harga garam seharga Rp 28 ribu per satu karung atau seberat 70 kilo gram. Saat itu, garam milik warga tidak bisa didistribusikan ke luar karena berbenturan pada proses pembangunan atau pengerjaan jalan tersebut yang selesai pada 28 Oktober 2019."Akibatnya, garam yang ada di masyarakat tidak kebagian pangsa pasar seharga Rp 28 ribu, karena sekarang sudah turun menjadi Rp 16 ribu per sak atau 70 kilo gramnya. Ya jika di kalkulasi kerugian masyarakat dengan keberadaan garam yang ada mencapai Rp 500 juta lebih. Terus siapa yang mau bertanggung jawab atas kerugian ini," bebernya.Menanggapi ini, Plt Kepala Dinas Pekerjaan Umum dan Penataan Ruang (DPUPR) Sampang, Ach Hafi membenarkan jika pemerintah daerah mengerjakan program peningkatan infrastruktur jalan di Desa Asem Nonggal dengan maksud membantu masyarakat untuk peningkatan transportasi dan perekonomian masyarakat desa setempat."Memang ada aturan yang harus dilalui, jika memang tonase delapan ton, maka janganlah dilintasi dengan muatan 10 ton atau lebih, karena akan merusak jalan itu sendiri," kilahnya.Disinggung bobot kekuatan tonase jalan yang sudah diperbaiki, pihaknya mengaku seberat delapan ton sebagaimana bobot kendaraan yang dipakai masyarakat setempat pada unumnya. Akan tetapi menurutnya, keluhan masyarakat yang muncul saat ini dinilai hanya kurang koordinasi dan sosialisasi pihak pemerintahan desa setempat kepada masyarakatnya."Cuma memang kurang sosialisasi saja. Sebenarnya, maksud batasan tonase baik agar jalan tidak cepat rusak. Namun di sisi lain ada yang dirugikan, tapi sudah ada solusi kok," dalihnya.

Sampang Salt Farmers Complain about Road Improvement Project
Nov 04 2019, 21:06 by Alfin Nuary


Sampang Salt Farmers Complain about Road Improvement Project

KBRN, Sampang: A number of salt farmers on Monday (11/04/2019) came to the Sampang Public Works and Spatial Planning Office. They questioned the policy of using the access road of Asem Nonggal Village - Panyepen, Jrengik District, which allegedly harmed salt farmers when they wanted to distribute their salt products outside the area or village. The reason is that access to the road infrastructure is limited to tonnage. As a result, the public complained because they felt disadvantaged, especially in the operational costs of transportation and transporters because they had to incur additional costs. Not just a matter of operational losses, said one of the Asem Nonggal warriors, Mahmudi said, the loss of salt farmers also occurred when the salt price was Rp. 28 thousand per one sack or weighing 70 kilo grams. At that time, the salt of the residents could not be distributed outside because it collided with the construction or construction of the road which was completed on October 28, 2019. "As a result, salt in the community did not receive a market share of Rp. 28 thousand, because now it has dropped to Rp. 16 thousand per sack or 70 kilo grams. Yes, if it is calculated that the loss of the community in the presence of salt reaches more than Rp 500 million. Then who wants to be responsible for this loss, "he explained. Responding to this, Acting Head of the Department of Public Works and Spatial Planning (DPUPR) Sampang, Ach Hafi confirmed that if the local government is working on a road infrastructure improvement program in Asem Nonggal Village with the aim of helping the community to improve transportation and the economy of the local village community. "There are rules that must be passed, if there is an eight-ton tonnage, then don't cross with a load of 10 tons or more, because it will damage the road itself, "he explained ung the strength of the tonnage strength of the road that has been repaired, he claimed to weigh eight tons as the weight of the vehicle used by the local community at unumnya. However, according to him, community complaints that arise at this time are considered only lacking coordination and socialization of the local village administration to the community. "It's just not enough socialization. Actually, the purpose of tonnage limits is good so that roads are not easily damaged. But on the other hand there are disadvantages, but there is already a solution, "he argued.
